definition: talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Sublevel caving method without sill pillar is adopted in the south section of Fengshan Copper Mine.
sentences.chinese: 豐山銅礦南緣採區應用無底柱分段崩落法採礦。

sentences.english: This paper discusses some geomechanics problems in block caving.
sentences.chinese: 本文論述了階段自然崩落法的幾個巖體力學問題。

sentences.english: Sub-level caving is an efficient and safe mining method.
sentences.chinese: 無底柱分段崩落採礦法是一種高效安全的採礦法。

sentences.english: Huge rockslides at times bury bulldozers and other machines.
sentences.chinese: 有時候巨大岩石崩落埋沒了壓路機及其他機器。

sentences.english: Sublevel caving without sill pillar is used in Xishimen Iron Mine.
sentences.chinese: 西石門鐵礦採用無底柱分段崩落採礦法開採。

sentences.english: Within the huge sound, the Great Wall was being avalanched and collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 隨着隆隆的巨響，長城也隨之開始崩落塌陷。

definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break up
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
crushed or broken rock, stone etc
variant of 岩層|岩层[yan2 ceng2]/rock strata
to collapse (of building, dam or bridge)
